title: English Language Familiarization Quiz - Medium Difficulty
description: Enhance your English skills with this quiz focusing on sentence construction, vocabulary, and common expressions.
instructions: Write your answer in English, focusing on correct usage and grammar.
After completing all questions, submit your answers for evaluation.

items.question: Rewrite the sentence using a relative clause: 'She bought a car. It was too expensive.'
items.suggestedAnswer: She bought a car that was too expensive.

items.question: Explain the meaning of the idiom 'to hit the nail on the head'.
items.suggestedAnswer: To describe exactly what is causing a situation or problem.

items.question: Fill in the blank with the correct form of the verb: 'If I ___ (know) about the traffic, I would have left earlier.'
What does the phrasal verb 'to run into someone' mean?
Choose the correct word: 'Her hypothesis provided a(n) ___ (invaluable/invalid) contribution to the research.'
Convert to indirect speech: 'She said, "I have never been to Australia."'
items.suggestedAnswer: She said that she had never been to Australia.

items.question: Complete the sentence with the appropriate preposition: 'We are concerned ___ the rising costs.'
What does the word 'quintessential' mean?
items.suggestedAnswer: Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.

items.question: Rewrite the sentence in the past perfect tense: 'She arrives at the party.'
items.suggestedAnswer: She had arrived at the party.
